sen.j: 南画（なんが）とは、中国の南宗画に由来する 日本独特の用語である。
sen.e: Nanga is a term which came from Chinese Southern Sung painting, and the term is unique to Japanese language.
Nanga is a term which came from Chinese Southern Sung paintings, and the term is unique to the Japanese language.
Nanga is a term which came from Chinese Southern Sung paintings, and the term is unique to the Japanese language.
It is also called bunjinga (literati painting).
It is also called bunjinga (literati painting).
It is also called bunjinga (literati painting).

sen.j: 南宗画は17世紀に明末の理論家によって、禅の流派名から作られた概念で、地理的な南北とは関係がない。
sen.e: Nansoga (Southern Sung painting) is an idea which was created from the name of Zen school by a theorist who lived in the Ming dynasty during the 17th century, and it has nothing to do with geographical north and south.
sen.cmt: 「明末」の意味がわかりませんでしたので、仮に「明」と訳しておきました。
sen.e: Nansoga (Southern Sung painting) is an idea which was created from the name of a Zen school by a theorist who lived in the Ming dynasty during the 17th century, and it has nothing to do with geographical north and south.

Nansoga (Southern Sung painting) is an idea which was created from the name of a Zen school by a theorist who lived in the Ming dynasty during the 17th century, and it has nothing to do with geographical north and south.

sen.j: 南画は南宗画の略称であるが、日本では中国での概念と異なり、長崎市を経て輸入された17～19世紀の中国の絵画、絵画教科書、絵画理論書、版画などをもとにして発生した絵画の流派をさす。
sen.e: Although Nanga is an abbreviation of Nansoga, it is different from the idea circulating in China, and in Japan, the term refers to a school of painting which was generated on the basis of the Chinese paintings during the 17th - 19th centuries which were imported via Nagasaki city, text books of painting, theories of painting, block prints, etc.

Although Nanga is an abbreviation of Nansoga, it is different from the idea circulating in China, and in Japan, the term refers to a school of painting which was generated on the basis of the Chinese paintings during the 17th - 19th centuries which were imported via Nagasaki city, text books of painting, theories of painting, block prints, etc.

Although Nanga is an abbreviation of Nansoga, it is different from the idea circulating in China, and in Japan, the term refers to a school of painting which was generated on the basis of the Chinese paintings during the 17th - 19th centuries which were imported via Nagasaki city, text books of painting, theories of painting, block prints, etc.

sen.j: 「文人画」の意味も中国とは異なり、単なる絵画様式である。
sen.e: The meaning of 'bunjinga' is also different from that in China, and it indicates simply a style of painting.
The meaning of 'bunjinga' is also different from that in China, and it indicates simply a style of painting.
The meaning of 'bunjinga' is also different from that in China, and it indicates simply a style of painting.

sen.j: 一部の画家は長崎へ来日した清人の画家に学んでいる。
sen.e: Some painters learnt under the Qing painters who came to Nagasaki.
Some painters learned under the Qing painters who came to Nagasaki.
Some painters learned under the Qing painters who came to Nagasaki.

sen.j: 写実でなく「写意」を旨とし、「気韻生動（風格・気品がいきいきと満ち溢れている）」を理想とした。
sen.e: It does not aim at realism, but at 'describing feelings,' and makes it ideal to 'be filled with lively grace and dignity.'
It does not aim at realism, but at 'describing feelings,' and makes it ideal to 'be filled with lively grace and dignity.'
It does not aim at realism, but at 'describing feelings,' and makes it ideal to 'be filled with lively grace and dignity.'

sen.j: 18世紀後半から19世紀末（明治前期）に流行した。
sen.e: It was widely liked from the latter half of the 18th century to the end of the 19th century (the first half of the Meiji period).
It was widely liked from the latter half of the 18th century to the end of the 19th century (the first half of the Meiji period).
It was widely liked from the latter half of the 18th century to the end of the 19th century (the first half of the Meiji period).

sen.j: 代表的な画家は、祇園南海（1676年 - 1751年）、彭城百川（1698年 - 1753年）、柳沢淇園（1706年 - 1758年）、池大雅、与謝蕪村、浦上玉堂、青木木米、谷文晁、渡辺華山、田能村竹田、椿椿山、富岡鉄斎。
sen.e: The representative painters were Nankai GION (1676-1751), Hyakusen SAKAKI (1698-1753), Kien YANAGISAWA (1706-1758), IKE no Taiga, Buson YOSA, Gyokudo URAGAMI, Mokubei AOKI, Buncho TANI, Kazan WATANABE, Chikuden TANOMURA, and Tessai TOMIOKA.

The representative painters were Nankai GION (1676-1751), Hyakusen SAKAKI (1698-1753), Kien YANAGISAWA (1706-1758), IKE no Taiga, Buson YOSA, Gyokudo URAGAMI, Mokubei AOKI, Buncho TANI, Kazan WATANABE, Chikuden TANOMURA, and Tessai TOMIOKA.

The representative painters were Nankai GION (1676-1751), Hyakusen SAKAKI (1698-1753), Kien YANAGISAWA (1706-1758), IKE no Taiga, Buson YOSA, Gyokudo URAGAMI, Mokubei AOKI, Buncho TANI, Kazan WATANABE, Chikuden TANOMURA, Chinzan TSUBAKI and Tessai TOMIOKA.
